alert.note: Alert for Nicholas; Randolph; Upshur; Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 4:58PM EDT until May 08 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Central West Virginia, central West Virginia, northern West Virginia and southern West Virginia, including the following counties, in Central West Virginia, Braxton. In central West Virginia, Clay, Nicholas and Webster. In northern West Virginia, Barbour, Randolph and Upshur. In southern West Virginia, Fayette and Kanawha. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elkins, Summersville, Clay, Webster Springs, Belington, Ansted, Gassaway, Addison (Webster Springs), Mill Creek, Camden-On-gauley, Holly River State Park, Camden On Gauley, Birch River, Craigsville, Dailey, Glen, Harrison, Beverly, Cowen and Junior. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
